greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = smallest number k such that A082467(k) = n.
comment: This is simply the smallest inverse to A082467. Note that A082467 has offset 4. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 15 2020
mathematica: f[n_] := Block[{k}, If[ OddQ[n], k = 2, k = 1]; While[ !PrimeQ[n - k] || !PrimeQ[n + k], k += 2]; k]; t = Table[ f[n], {n, 4, 2600}]; u = Table[0, {60}]; Do[a = t[[n]]; If[a < 61 && u[[a]] == 0, u[[a]] = n + 3], {n, 2597}]; u
program: a(n) = my(k=4); while (a082467(k) != n, k++); k; \\ _Michel Marcus_, Feb 12 2020
xref: Cf. A082467. Records are in A104884.
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_ and _Robert G. Wilson v_, Mar 28 2005
ext: Definition corrected by _Giovanni Resta_. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 15 2020
